title: How to Draw an Anime Girl

steps.headline: Sketch the wireframe of a young girl.
steps.description: Draw a larger head to represent a child's proportion.

steps.headline: Sketch additional shapes, to build the body.
Sketch the figure, using the shapes as a guide.
Add details.
steps.description: These include hair, clothes, and accessories.

steps.headline: Refine the artwork.
steps.description: Use a smaller tipped drawing tool.

steps.headline: Draw the outline over the sketch.
Erase and remove the sketch marks.
Add color to the artwork.
Make an outline of the anime girl using stick figures and shapes.
steps.description: First, sketch a circle for the head. Add an angled shape on the lower part of the circle for the chin and jaw. Use a short line for the neck. Connect a curved line from the neck down to where the pelvis would be located. Draw a four-pointed shape for the thorax and attach more lines for the limbs. Use a triangle as guide for the hands.

steps.headline: Use the stick figure as guide.
steps.description: Draw the girl's body and add shape to the drawing. Take note of the proportions and where joints are located. Add a crossed line to the face and thorax to help you determine accurate positioning of body parts later.

steps.headline: Sketch the eyes.
steps.description: Position it, or, more conventionally them, with the help of the crossed line as an outline. Add small curved strokes for the eyebrows. Sketch an angle for the nose and a small curved line for the lips.

steps.headline: Design a hairstyle for your anime character.
steps.description: Here in this illustration, it is a simple style that can be achieved by sketching slanted and curved strokes. You can also add a bow or a pin or any accessory on the hair for design.

steps.headline: Choose a design for the character’s outfit.
steps.description: School uniforms are a common choice. A simple blazer and pleated skirt would be nice.

steps.headline: Refine details and erase unnecessary lines.
Color your drawing.
steps.description: You might want to make it neutral colors, so they look good, not so they clash. The choice is yours though, team orange and purple if you like. It's your drawing.

steps.headline: Create other clothing designs.
steps.description: Come up with other ideas that you can use for the school uniform of your anime character.

steps.headline: Sketch the wireframe of a teenage girl.
Sketch additional shapes to build the body.
Sketch the figure using the shapes as a guide.
Add the hair, clothes, and accessories.
Refine the artwork.
steps.description: Use a smaller tipped drawing tool.

steps.headline: Draw the outline over the sketch.
Erase and remove the sketch marks.
Add color to the artwork.

methods.name: Drawing an Anime Girl in Swimwear

steps.headline: Make an outline of the anime girl using stick figures and shapes.
steps.description: First, sketch a circle for the head. Add an angled shape on the lower part of the circle for the chin and jaw. Use a line for the neck down to where the pelvis would be located. Draw an inverted dome shape for the thorax and attach more lines to the limbs. You can use a triangle as a guide for the hands.

steps.headline: Using the stick figure as a guide, add shape to the drawing.
steps.description: Take note of the proportions and where joints are located. Add a crossed line on the face and thorax to help you determine accurate positioning of body parts later. Since this character will be wearing a swimwear, indicate where the breasts are located using two teardrop shapes. Add a small slanted stroke for the navel.

steps.headline: Sketch the eyes.
steps.description: Position it with the help of the crossed line as an outline. Add small curved strokes for the eyebrows. Sketch an angle for the nose and two small curved line for the lips to make the character looks like she is smiling.

steps.headline: Design a hairstyle for your anime character.
steps.description: You can use curved strokes to make the hair look wavy or make the hair limp, as if it were wet. Add a C shape on each side for the ears, peeking a little from the thick hair of your anime girl.

steps.headline: Darken the outline of the body.
steps.description: Choose a design for the character’s swimwear. A two-piece is a simple and common choice.

steps.headline: Refine details.
Color your masterpiece.
Look at other ideas you can use for your anime character.

tyn: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
Pen (black or blue) to outline the drawing (optional)
text: Drawing a Young Anime Girl Sketch the wireframe of a young girl. Draw a larger head to represent a child's proportion. Sketch additional shapes, to build the body.  Sketch the figure, using the shapes as a guide.  Add details. These include hair, clothes, and accessories. Refine the artwork. Use a smaller tipped drawing tool. Draw the outline over the sketch.  Erase and remove the sketch marks.  Add color to the artwork.  Drawing an Anime School Girl Make an outline of the anime girl using stick figures and shapes. First, sketch a circle for the head. Add an angled shape on the lower part of the circle for the chin and jaw. Use a short line for the neck. Connect a curved line from the neck down to where the pelvis would be located. Draw a four-pointed shape for the thorax and attach more lines for the limbs. Use a triangle as guide for the hands. Use the stick figure as guide. Draw the girl's body and add shape to the drawing. Take note of the proportions and where joints are located. Add a crossed line to the face and thorax to help you determine accurate positioning of body parts later. Sketch the eyes. Position it, or, more conventionally them, with the help of the crossed line as an outline. Add small curved strokes for the eyebrows. Sketch an angle for the nose and a small curved line for the lips. Design a hairstyle for your anime character. Here in this illustration, it is a simple style that can be achieved by sketching slanted and curved strokes. You can also add a bow or a pin or any accessory on the hair for design. Choose a design for the character’s outfit. School uniforms are a common choice. A simple blazer and pleated skirt would be nice. Refine details and erase unnecessary lines.  Color your drawing. You might want to make it neutral colors, so they look good, not so they clash. The choice is yours though, team orange and purple if you like. It's your drawing. Create other clothing designs. Come up with other ideas that you can use for the school uniform of your anime character. Drawing a Teenage Anime Girl Sketch the wireframe of a teenage girl.  Sketch additional shapes to build the body.  Sketch the figure using the shapes as a guide.  Add the hair, clothes, and accessories.  Refine the artwork. Use a smaller tipped drawing tool. Draw the outline over the sketch.  Erase and remove the sketch marks.  Add color to the artwork.  Drawing an Anime Girl in Swimwear Make an outline of the anime girl using stick figures and shapes. First, sketch a circle for the head. Add an angled shape on the lower part of the circle for the chin and jaw. Use a line for the neck down to where the pelvis would be located. Draw an inverted dome shape for the thorax and attach more lines to the limbs. You can use a triangle as a guide for the hands. Using the stick figure as a guide, add shape to the drawing. Take note of the proportions and where joints are located. Add a crossed line on the face and thorax to help you determine accurate positioning of body parts later. Since this character will be wearing a swimwear, indicate where the breasts are located using two teardrop shapes. Add a small slanted stroke for the navel. Sketch the eyes. Position it with the help of the crossed line as an outline. Add small curved strokes for the eyebrows. Sketch an angle for the nose and two small curved line for the lips to make the character looks like she is smiling. Design a hairstyle for your anime character. You can use curved strokes to make the hair look wavy or make the hair limp, as if it were wet. Add a C shape on each side for the ears, peeking a little from the thick hair of your anime girl. Darken the outline of the body. Choose a design for the character’s swimwear. A two-piece is a simple and common choice. Refine details. Erase unnecessary lines. Color your masterpiece.  Look at other ideas you can use for your anime character.

Use a short line for the neck.
Connect a curved line from the neck down to where the pelvis would be located.
Draw a four-pointed shape for the thorax and attach more lines for the limbs.

Use the stick figure as guide.
Draw the girl's body and add shape to the drawing.
Take note of the proportions and where joints are located.

Drawing an Anime Girl in Swimwear Make an outline of the anime girl using stick figures and shapes.
First, sketch a circle for the head.
Add an angled shape on the lower part of the circle for the chin and jaw.
Use a line for the neck down to where the pelvis would be located.
Draw an inverted dome shape for the thorax and attach more lines to the limbs.
You can use a triangle as a guide for the hands.
Using the stick figure as a guide, add shape to the drawing.
Take note of the proportions and where joints are located.
Add a crossed line on the face and thorax to help you determine accurate positioning of body parts later.
Since this character will be wearing a swimwear, indicate where the breasts are located using two teardrop shapes.
Add a small slanted stroke for the navel.
Sketch the eyes.
Position it with the help of the crossed line as an outline.
Add small curved strokes for the eyebrows.
Sketch an angle for the nose and two small curved line for the lips to make the character looks like she is smiling.
Design a hairstyle for your anime character.
You can use curved strokes to make the hair look wavy or make the hair limp, as if it were wet.
Add a C shape on each side for the ears, peeking a little from the thick hair of your anime girl.
Darken the outline of the body.
Choose a design for the character’s swimwear.
A two-piece is a simple and common choice.
Refine details.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color your masterpiece.
Look at other ideas you can use for your anime character.
